label: Sub Pop Records
description: Rarely has an album owed so much to production... Low return with their most daring, experimental release in years, co-produced by James Blake's man at the controls B.J. label: Domino Recording Co
description:
Tirzah pursues the slowest-burning soul feels on Devotion, the London-based singer-songwriter’s humbly singular début album, produced by Mica Levi and providing us with total life affirming summer listening - most probably the record we've listened to most this year so far, and one that lingers on and on...

Since her first solo 12”s  and thru frequent... more

label: Kranky
description: The first Grouper album in 4 years finds Liz Harris stripped of FX, pairing her vocals with skeletal piano gestures in beautifully pregnant space. For anyone familiar with the miasmic fuzz of Grouper’s previous releases, the relative clarity is quietly shocking in effect, revealing her songs and sound at their most vulnerable, and, in the process, locating a... more

label: Sargent House
description:
In the year of his 50th birthday, Earth’s Dylan Carlson mounts his 4th solo album Conquistador, spelling out a signature, disenchanted sound ideal for brooding in the desert while waiting for the eschaton. 

Accompanied by Converge guitarist Kurt Ballou on 2nd guitar and production, as well as Emma Ruth Rundle (Red Sparrowes, Marriages), and his wife Holly... more

label: THIRD MAN
description:
We’re not sure what strain woke Al Cisneros and Matt Pike to the idea of reviving Sleep as a recording entity, but we wouldn’t mind a toke. 

Nearly 10 years since they returned to live scene, and over 20 since they more or less forged the stoner rock genre with ‘Jerusalem’ and ‘Dopesmoker’, they remain a heavy proposition, now bolstered by percussion from Jason... more

description:
Autechre weigh in the labyrinthine 8 hour ‘NTS Sessions’, parsing the guts of their hard drives for gold and other precious materials dating back to 2011

The duo were initially commissioned to do a DJ residency on NTS, following their show from early 2016, but what transpired is closer in approach and results to a super extended Peel Session, featuring stacks... more
